abstract:
"To come" is a printing and journalism reference, commonly abbreviated to "TK". It is used to signify that additional material will be added at a later date.TK as an abbreviation may originally have come into use because very few English words feature this letter combination. The phrase "to come", by contrast, could potentially be mistaken as a deliberate part of the text.
The Chicago Manual of Style online Q&A on manuscript preparation describes this shorthand as "imprecise", stating,

It's best to be more straightforward and specific. For example, use bullets or boldface zeros (••• or 000) to stand in for page numbers that cannot be determined until a manuscript is paginated as a book (but see paragraph 2.37 in CMOS). For items like missing figures, describe exactly what's missing. In electronic environments, you have recourse to comment features, like the <!--comment--> syntax of SGML, which allows for descriptive instructions that will not interfere with the final version of a document.
title: To come (publishing)

abstract:
After completing qualitative research seeking human resource managers’ perceptions of
workers with learning disabilities in the workplace, we took these results to the Bahamas Society of Human Research Management conference. Attendees included managers in various human resource positions as well as vice presidents and top decision-makers from many of the top banking, industry, government, and tourist organizations. After presenting this group with the findings from our research on workers with neurodiversity, the researchers asked those attending to respond to the same questions from the original research, including the same demographic descriptors. The research utilizes Boyer’s Model of scholarship’s third element, application of research findings, shared directly with those in a professional association. Thus, we had academic research presented to those in industry, who then added to existing research from their given perspectives. The qualitative inquiry, a collaborative social research, generated responses that were coded and analyzed in this paper. This research furthers the knowledge of addressing workers in the workplace that possess learning disabilities and HR’s responsibility and knowledge to train, educate, and be able to make reasonable accommodation in accordance with HR diversity requirements.

Keywords: HRM practices, neurodiversity in the workplace, Bahamas human research
management, qualitative research.
title: From Academia to Industry: C-Suite Contributors to Perspectives on Neurodiversity in the Workplace
